The euler angles are 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 degrees and the translation vector is [0.0, 0.5, 0.0]. Next, create the 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. * Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.0]. * Draw a line from point [0.75, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.625]. * Draw a line from point [0.75, 0.625] to point [0.0, 0.625]. * Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.625] to point [0.0, 0.0]. The sketch is now complete, with one face and one loop consisting of four lines. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the positive normal direction by a depth of 0.5 units, creating the 3D prism. Part 2 Construct an angular, geometric shape with a flat base and a pointed top. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. The euler angles are -90.0, 0.0, -90.0 degrees and the translation vector is [0.75, 0.0, 0.1258]. Next, create the 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. * Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.3734, 0.4992]. * Draw a line from point [0.3734, 0.4992] to point [0.0, 0.4992]. * Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.4992] to point [0.0, 0.0]. The sketch is now complete, with one face and one loop consisting of three lines. Do not scale the 2D sketch. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the coordinate system. Cut the 3D sketch by a depth of 0.25 units in the opposite direction of the positive normal, removing material from the solid. The resulting shape is a three-dimensional, angular, geometric shape with a flat base and a pointed top. The dimensions are not provided as they depend on Part 1's dimensions due to the subtractive operation.</description>
